2021-09-12T14:41:25Z: And that concludes the triple header - we'll see you in two weeks' time for the Russian GP at Sochi. Enjoy the rest of your day, and thanks for joining us!
2021-09-12T14:40:30Z: We'll leave you to enjoy the podium celebrations - meanwhile, here's the race report: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-italian-gp-ricciardo-leads-mclaren-1-2-verstappen-and-hamilton-collide/6666361/
2021-09-12T14:38:46Z: It's time to fill your boots, Australia - we're getting a shoey.
2021-09-12T14:31:15Z: Obviously, the thing Ricciardo is most excited about is driving Dale Earnhardt's old NASCAR Cup Chevy Monte Carlo - owned by Zak Brown.
2021-09-12T14:27:08Z: Sainz claims sixth place from Stroll, with Alonso, Russell and Ocon rounding out the scorers.
2021-09-12T14:26:39Z: Bottas completes the podium ahead of Leclerc, as Perez drops to fifth after his penalty.
2021-09-12T14:25:44Z: Until now! Daniel Ricciardo wins the Italian Grand Prix - taking the fastest lap too! Lando Norris completes a McLaren 1-2!
2021-09-12T14:25:07Z: Carlos Sainz Jr was within a whisker of winning this race last season - but McLaren still hasn't won since the 2012 Brazilian Grand Prix...
2021-09-12T14:24:05Z: The two McLarens begin the final lap of the race.
2021-09-12T14:23:48Z: Perez is doing enough to keep Bottas at bay, and has over five seconds over Sainz now.
2021-09-12T14:23:07Z: Stroll, running well in P7, is under investigation for failing to slow under yellow flags. That could be trouble, with both Alonso and Russell less than five seconds behind him.
2021-09-12T14:20:58Z: Bottas had been getting closer to Perez once again, but it seems every time he gets within a decent range, Perez finds a bit more in reserve.
2021-09-12T14:20:50Z: Giovinazzi gets ahead of Kubica, taking P13 off his Alfa Romeo stand-in team-mate. It could have been so much more for the Italian but his first lap clash set in motion a tough afternoon.
2021-09-12T14:18:33Z: With five laps to go a lot of driver are being pinged for track limits at the final corner. Vettel, Russell and Alonso the latest to be warned about it.
2021-09-12T14:17:59Z: Norris is closing up on Ricciardo slightly now, giving him a bit more protection from the cars behind - which have fanned out a bit now and no longer have use of DRS on each other.
2021-09-12T14:15:57Z: Vettel gets ahead of Kubica to take P12 at the return to green flag action.
2021-09-12T14:14:19Z: We're back to green flag racing, and Ricciardo is on the precipice of a 2s gap out front. Norris has also dropped Perez, despite the Mexican's rapid reaction to the VSC ending.
2021-09-12T14:12:25Z: Mazepin has stopped on the exit of the Ascari chicane. That's the end of his race. Virtual Safety Car deployed.
2021-09-12T14:11:45Z: Bottas gets a run on Perez into the Curva Grande and passes, but goes too deep into the chicane - which lets Perez re-pass him. Toto Wolff went through the gamut of expressions in that one second.
2021-09-12T14:08:31Z: The news of his penalty must have shocked Mazepin, as he locks up under braking for the first chicane and takes to the run-off. The Russian duly pits at the end of the lap having flat-spotted his tyres.
2021-09-12T14:08:01Z: Norris gets the call to keep the status quo between him and Ricciardo.
2021-09-12T14:06:06Z: Mazepin has been given a five-second time penalty for the clash with team-mate Schumacher. That'll go down well at Haas.
2021-09-12T14:06:03Z: Leclerc's found a bit more pace, and is closing up on Bottas now. The top six is now with six seconds!
2021-09-12T14:04:37Z: Away from the track action, here's the latest on the clash between Hamilton and Verstappen which will be investigated after the race: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/hamilton-and-verstappen-crash-set-for-post-italian-gp-investigation/6666333/
2021-09-12T14:03:03Z: Perez has a five-second time penalty for passing Leclerc off the circuit.
2021-09-12T14:01:20Z: Ricciardo does indeed pull his finger out, going faster than the cars immediately behind him.
2021-09-12T14:01:04Z: Both the Vettel vs Schumacher and Schumacher vs Mazepin clashes have been noted by the stewards. It could be a long afternoon in the 'telling off' office at the end of this race.
2021-09-12T13:59:19Z: Bottas does a 1m24.827s, as he now plans to cut through the leading trio.
2021-09-12T13:57:53Z: Bottas comes up for another bite at Leclerc, and dispatches him more cleanly at the start of Lap 34 into Turn 1.
2021-09-12T13:57:37Z: All of that has seen Ocon move up to P10 ahead of Latifi, Kubica and Vettel.
2021-09-12T13:56:53Z: Bottas then charges past Leclerc at the opening chicane, leaving Leclerc out of road. The Ferrari driver gives up P4, but somehow gets it back with a good run into the next chicane!
2021-09-12T13:56:17Z: And at the second chicane Schumacher clashes with Haas team-mate Mazepin, which pushes the German into a spin. Those two really don't like each other.
2021-09-12T13:55:34Z: Perez and Leclerc are fighting hard over third - the Mexican leaps over the chicane and takes the place, so he'll have to give it back.
2021-09-12T13:55:32Z: On lap 32 the midfield is still yet to settle down as Schumacher bumps into his good friend Vettel at the first chicane, pushing the Aston Martin driver over the sausage kerb.
2021-09-12T13:54:48Z: Bottas now shapes up a move on Sainz into the chicane, making it up into fifth.
2021-09-12T13:54:24Z: It's a McLaren 1-2 then as it stands, from Leclerc and Perez.
2021-09-12T13:53:37Z: Norris dives down the inside of Leclerc, but can't make it past at the opening chicane - but cruises past at Curva Grande, after touching the grass!
2021-09-12T13:52:54Z: Ricciardo bolts and gets us back underway!
2021-09-12T13:51:17Z: Both cars have been cleared from the gravel trap so the return to racing won't be far away.
2021-09-12T13:49:14Z: With one eye on the rest of this race, everyone has pitted under this safety car, while Vettel pitted for a second time in this race. Bottas in P6 has the fastest car and is on the fastest tyre, the mediums, with everyone ahead of him on the hards.
2021-09-12T13:47:03Z: So naturally, the Verstappen/Hamilton incident is under investigation.
2021-09-12T13:45:37Z: Let's go through it again, Hamilton tried to cover Verstappen out of the pits, and the Dutchman was left to hit the kerb, gets airborne and clouts the rollhoop and halo of Hamilton's car.
2021-09-12T13:44:02Z: Leclerc's benefitted massively from that, conducting his stop under the safety car to now sit in second. Perez moves up to fourth, behind Norris in third.
2021-09-12T13:43:02Z: Verstappen's car is wedged on top of Hamilton's car - and Hamilton is told to switch off the car.
2021-09-12T13:42:07Z: Safety car deployed! That is the most bizarre crash ever!
2021-09-12T13:41:57Z: Hamilton and Verstappen coalesce into the first chicane - and they've taken each other out! They're stuck in the gravel, and they're OUT!
2021-09-12T13:41:28Z: Hamilton now pits, collecting medium tyres, with a slight delay - which lets Norris through...BUT
2021-09-12T13:40:50Z: Pitstops all over the shop now with the midfield shuffled up!
2021-09-12T13:40:07Z: Norris now comes in, collecting hards for himself as Sainz is now cleared by Riciardo. Norris rejoins ahead of Verstappen as a result of the slow Red Bull stop.
2021-09-12T13:39:13Z: Hamilton meanwhile dispatches Norris at the second chicane, compounding Verstappen's misery! The Mercedes driver tracked him through Curva Grande and got him at Variante della Roggia.
2021-09-12T13:38:13Z: Verstappen now follows up with a stop, complaining that his tyres are done. It's a VERY slow stop for Verstappen, 11s left in the box!
2021-09-12T13:36:48Z: Presumably, Verstappen was told to do whatever Ricciardo didn't, and stayed out.
2021-09-12T13:36:04Z: At the start of lap 22 Bottas is up to eighth place, diving up the inside of Stroll at the first chicane. He's now got a six-second gap to Sainz ahead of him.
2021-09-12T13:34:41Z: Verstappen went far too deep into the Turn 1 chicane at the start of lap 21, losing about 0.4s to Ricciardo in the process as he clattered over the kerbs.
2021-09-12T13:32:30Z: Ocon has been given a five-second time penalty for that earlier clash with Vettel.
2021-09-12T13:30:32Z: Verstappen reports his rears are sliding, which is now keeping him out of Ricciardo's DRS range. Hamilton is also over a second behind Norris.
2021-09-12T13:30:07Z: Bottas is up to P9 now having got by Alonso and next on his radar is Stroll. That's impressive work by the Mercedes driver in just 18 laps.
2021-09-12T13:28:51Z: Leclerc is no longer homing in on Norris and Hamilton. This is no longer podracing.
2021-09-12T13:27:11Z: Vettel isn't having a nice time of things. After a close shave with Stroll earlier, he has just been biffed by Ocon as he was squeezed to the outside braking for the second chicane. That's already under investigation with the stewards.
2021-09-12T13:25:40Z: Leclerc has homed in on Norris and Hamilton now, so he's coming into play slowly.
2021-09-12T13:23:16Z: And just like, Bottas gets another one. The Mercedes driver dives up the inside of Latifi in the braking zone for the first chicane. That's P10 for the Finn.
2021-09-12T13:22:29Z: A few drivers are getting track limits notices through the Parabolica - the perils of paving over gravel traps.
2021-09-12T13:21:47Z: The other Mercedes is making moves stick, as Bottas gets by Ocon to take P11.
2021-09-12T13:21:14Z: Hamilton has a crack at Norris into Turn 1 at the top of lap 12, but Norris holds the line into the chicane - and into the next one, despite the Mercedes' drivers efforts into Curva Grande.
2021-09-12T13:20:01Z: Bottas is up to P12 now getting by Vettel. Ahead of him next is Ocon and then Latifi to return to the points places.
2021-09-12T13:17:24Z: Perez is up to P6! He goes wheel to wheel with Sainz around Curva Grande after passing at the first chicane and defends his position at the second chicane.
2021-09-12T13:14:48Z: Giovinazzi has a five-second penalty for rejoining the circuit unsafely on lap 1.
2021-09-12T13:12:34Z: During the first lap action we've not had a chance to update Bottas's progress from the back of the grid. He's just blasted by Russell on the main straight to take P13.
2021-09-12T13:12:14Z: The Sainz/Giovinazzi contact is now under investigation.
2021-09-12T13:11:11Z: Double DNF for AlphaTauri - Gasly's pre-race mechanical worries have come true as he retires at the end of lap four.
2021-09-12T13:11:13Z: Leclerc's put some distance between himself and team-mate Sainz, who is now under attack from Perez over sixth.
2021-09-12T13:10:13Z: Behind the clashes of the frontrunners, Vettel was shown the gravel by team-mate Stroll which forced the German driver to back out of it. He's dropped behind Stroll, Alonso, Ocon and Latifi and is P12.
2021-09-12T13:08:57Z: Verstappen hits back with a 1m25.808s, some way quicker than Ricciardo, to get within DRS range.
2021-09-12T13:08:47Z: Giovinazzi gets going again and pits at the end of the first lap for a new front wing. He returns to the action in P19 - Tsunoda did not make the start of this race and is out.
2021-09-12T13:07:34Z: Giovinazzi appears to run over the kerbs at the chicane, right behind the clash between Hamilton and Verstappen, and coming back on the tack clips Sainz's Ferrari. That sends the Italian driver into a bump with the wall.
2021-09-12T13:07:26Z: We had a brief VSC period, but we're back up and running again! Ricicardo leads, and is trying to break away from Verstappen, with Norris a little bit further behind.
2021-09-12T13:05:34Z: At the second chicane Giovinazzi is spun around! The Italian made a super start overtaking Sainz but then in congestion at the braking zone it all got a bit messy.
2021-09-12T13:05:28Z: Hamilton then goes side-by-side with Verstappen into the second chicane, but the two touch - and Norris gets third once again!
2021-09-12T13:04:57Z: That's a lovely start from Ricciardo, who outdrags Verstappen into the chicane and into the lead! Hamilton clears Norris off the line and claims P3.
2021-09-12T13:03:46Z: And the 2021 Italian Grand Prix is go!
2021-09-12T13:02:36Z: The cars line up, ready to get going into Turn 1...
2021-09-12T13:01:31Z: Brake problem for Tsunoda, then - that's stopping him getting into the race so far.
2021-09-12T12:59:19Z: Tyre news: Hamilton, Kubica, Bottas and Gasly start on hard tyres, everyone else begins on mediums.
2021-09-12T12:55:46Z: Nightmare for AlphaTauri - Tsunoda's being wheeled back to the pitlane. Gasly will start from the pitlane as well; a horrible situation for the team at its home race.
2021-09-12T12:54:02Z: Just over five minutes to go until the Italian Grand Prix kicks off for the formation lap.
2021-09-12T12:47:39Z: Those planes were incredibly well-timed with the national anthem. Wonder how many times they practiced that?
2021-09-12T12:43:48Z: Verstappen's on pole, but has the two McLarens surrounding him on the grid. Here's how the orange cars look this weekend: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/why-italian-gp-success-is-on-for-mclaren-even-if-verstappen-dominates/6666051/
2021-09-12T12:42:48Z: Hopefully AlphaTauri manages to get Gasly sorted enough for the race - but it sadly looks like a repeat of last year's result is unlikely at best.
2021-09-12T12:34:55Z: Good afternoon everyone - welcome to our Autosport Live coverage of the Italian Grand Prix at Monza! It's just 25 minutes until lights out.
